Share: Digg Facebook StumbleUpon Another Pictogram in Poland © 2004 by Linda Moulton Howe The small farming village of Kaczewo is in the Radziejow District of the Kujawsko-Pomorska Province northwest of Warsaw. August 29, 2004 Kaczewo, Kujawsko-Pomorska Province, Poland - Robert K. Lesniakiewicz, Vice President of the CBUFOIZA (researchers in Poland who investigate unidentified aerial objects and crop formations) reported on August 28, 2004: "A crop pictogram made from three elements in wheat (2 circles and 1 rectangle) was found in the Kaczewo village of the Radziejow District in Kujawsko-Pomorska Province. The biggest crop circle measures 7.4 meters in its diameter (24 feet). The agroformation seems to be authentic. It was examined by a team of the IRG Torun and photographs were made by Mr. Stan Barski." Above: Larger circle in wheat measured 7.4 meters (24 feet) reported August 28, 2004. Below: IRG Torun investigators inside one of the the Kaczewo village circles. Photographs © 2004 by Stan Barski.

Local residents gather in the rectangle pattern of the three-part pictogram reported August 28, 2004, in Kaczewo village, Radziejow District, Kujawsko-Pomorska Province, Poland. Photograph © 2004 by Stan Barski.
